ARLINGTON, TX 76006

citations.narrative:
The registrant has not developed a written contingency plan for the facility. The lack of an adequate contingency plan
could increase the risk of not being able to safeguard animals during emergencies or disasters. The facility must develop,
document and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care
of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster that could reasonably be anticipated for the species at the site.
The plan must address all the components of section 2.38(l)(1). Correct by November 30, 2024.

A written program of veterinary care for dogs was not available for review at the time of inspection. The facility employs a
full-time attending veterinarian who is responsible for overseeing the veterinary care provided to all the animals at the
facility; however, there is no written program documented regarding veterinary care for the dogs. A written program of
veterinary care for dogs is crucial to ensure the dogs are receiving proper medical and preventative care and that the
facility is following the attending veterinarian's guidance. The registrant must develop a written program of veterinary care
for dogs with all the components required and outlined in section 3.13(a). Correct by November 22, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.38(l)(1) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
The registrant has not developed a written contingency plan for the facility. The lack of an adequate contingency plan 
could increase the risk of not being able to safeguard animals during emergencies or disasters. The facility must develop, 
document and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care 
of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster that could reasonably be anticipated for the species at the site. 
The plan must address all the components of section 2.38(l)(1). Correct by November 30, 2024. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
A written program of veterinary care for dogs was not available for review at the time of inspection. The facility employs a 
full-time attending veterinarian who is responsible for overseeing the veterinary care provided to all the animals at the 
facility; however, there is no written program documented regarding veterinary care for the dogs. A written program of 
veterinary care for dogs is crucial to ensure the dogs are receiving proper medical and preventative care and that the 
facility is following the attending veterinarian's guidance. The registrant must develop a written program of veterinary care 
for dogs with all the components required and outlined in section 3.13(a). Correct by November 22, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
